images.name: nvcr.io/nvidia/pytorch:24.12-py3
images.notes: NVIDIA-optimized PyTorch with Transformer Engine, APEX, and NCCL. Best performance on H100, A100, and data center GPUs. Monthly releases with security patches.

images.name: nvcr.io/nvidia/tensorflow:24.12-tf2-py3
recommended_for: Maximum NVIDIA GPU performance with TensorFlow
images.notes: NVIDIA-optimized TensorFlow with TensorRT integration. Volta (V100) support will be discontinued by 25.01 release. Use NVIDIA driver 560+ for best compatibility.

images.name: nvidia/cuda:12.4.1-cudnn-devel-ubuntu22.04
images.notes: Full CUDA development image with cuDNN. Ideal base for building custom ML containers or compiling frameworks from source.

images.name: nvidia/cuda:12.4.1-devel-ubuntu22.04
images.notes: CUDA development image with nvcc compiler. Use for building custom CUDA kernels or compiling PyTorch/TensorFlow from source. Does NOT include cuDNN.

images.name: nvidia/cuda:12.4.1-runtime-ubuntu22.04
images.notes: Base CUDA runtime image. Use as FROM base for custom ML containers. Does NOT include cuDNN or Python - add those as needed.

images.name: ollama/ollama:latest
images.notes: Lightweight LLM runner. Run with: docker run --gpus all -v ollama:/root/.ollama -p 11434:11434 ollama/ollama. Supports NVIDIA (compute 5.0+) and AMD GPUs.

images.name: pytorch/pytorch:2.4.0-cuda11.8-cudnn9-runtime
images.notes: CUDA 11.8 variant for systems with older drivers or requiring broader GPU compatibility. Supports older Kepler architecture (compute capability 3.5+).

images.name: pytorch/pytorch:2.5.1-cuda12.4-cudnn9-devel
images.notes: Development variant with CUDA compiler (nvcc). Use this for custom CUDA kernels, torch.compile with Triton, or PyTorch extensions requiring compilation.

images.name: pytorch/pytorch:2.5.1-cuda12.4-cudnn9-runtime
images.notes: Official PyTorch image with CUDA 12.4 runtime. Use -devel variant if you need to compile custom CUDA kernels.

images.name: tensorflow/tensorflow:2.17.0
images.notes: CPU-only TensorFlow image. Much smaller than GPU variant. Good for inference or development on machines without NVIDIA GPUs.

images.name: tensorflow/tensorflow:2.17.0-gpu
images.notes: Official TensorFlow GPU image. For Jupyter support, use tensorflow/tensorflow:2.17.0-gpu-jupyter variant.

images.name: tensorflow/tensorflow:2.17.0-gpu-jupyter
images.notes: TensorFlow GPU image with Jupyter notebook server. Start with: docker run --gpus all -p 8888:8888 tensorflow/tensorflow:2.17.0-gpu-jupyter

images.name: ghcr.io/huggingface/text-generation-inference:3.3.5
images.notes: Hugging Face Text Generation Inference server. Optimized for H100, A100, A10G and T4 GPUs with CUDA 12.2+. Supports flash attention and continuous batching.

images.name: nvcr.io/nvidia/tritonserver:25.11-py3
images.notes: NVIDIA Triton Inference Server supports multiple frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, ONNX, TensorRT) and provides dynamic batching, model versioning, and ensemble models.

images.name: vllm/vllm-openai:latest
images.notes: Production-ready LLM inference server with OpenAI-compatible API. Supports continuous batching and PagedAttention for optimal GPU utilization.
